page.title: 08TOW LAW J.M. & I. SCHOOL.
page.content:
Tow Law has two primary schools; a small R.C. Aided School and the County School. Opened in 1954 this replaced the existing "tin" school. It is built on the southern edge of Tow Law, and has extensive open views.
At the present time there are approx. 180 pupils in the school with one class per age-group from 5-11 years. There are 9 teachers employed in the school, together with kitchen staff, cleaners, etc.
Generally the lessons are taken with the class teacher. Swimming lessons are held for the 9-11 year olds at a school pool in Wolsingham (3 miles).
At 11 the children transfer to the Comprehensive School in Wolsingham.
